verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>, Depart<WH3212>, and go up<WH5927> hence, thou and the people<WH5971> which thou hast brought up<WH5927> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, unto the land<WH776> which I sware<WH7650> unto Abraham<WH85>, to Isaac<WH3327>, and to Jacob<WH3290>, saying<WH559>, Unto thy seed<WH2233> will I give<WH5414> it:

And I will send<WH7971> an angel<WH4397> before<WH6440> thee; and I will drive out<WH1644> the Canaanite<WH3669>, the Amorite<WH567>, and the Hittite<WH2850>, and the Perizzite<WH6522>, the Hivite<WH2340>, and the Jebusite<WH2983>:

Unto a land<WH776> flowing<WH2100> with milk<WH2461> and honey<WH1706>: for I will not go up<WH5927> in the midst<WH7130> of thee; for thou art a stiffnecked<WH7186><WH6203> people<WH5971>: lest I consume<WH3615> thee in the way<WH1870>.
¶ And when the people<WH5971> heard<WH8085> these evil<WH7451> tidings<WH1697>, they mourned<WH56>: and no man<WH376> did put<WH7896> on him his ornaments<WH5716>.

For the LORD<WH3068> had said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Say<WH559> unto the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, Ye are a stiffnecked<WH7186><WH6203> people<WH5971>: I will come up<WH5927> into the midst<WH7130> of thee in a<WH259> moment<WH7281>, and consume<WH3615> thee: therefore now put off<WH3381> thy ornaments<WH5716> from thee, that I may know<WH3045> what to do<WH6213> unto thee.
And the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> stripped<WH5337> themselves of their ornaments<WH5716> by the mount<WH2022> Horeb<WH2722>.

And Moses<WH4872> took<WH3947> the tabernacle<WH168>, and pitched<WH5186> it without<WH2351> the camp<WH4264>, afar off<WH7368> from the camp<WH4264>, and called<WH7121> it the Tabernacle<WH168> of the congregation<WH4150>. And it came to pass, that every one which sought<WH1245> the LORD<WH3068> went out<WH3318> unto the tabernacle<WH168> of the congregation<WH4150>, which was without<WH2351> the camp<WH4264>.

And it came to pass, when Moses<WH4872> went out<WH3318> unto the tabernacle<WH168>, that all the people<WH5971> rose up<WH6965>, and stood<WH5324> every man<WH376> at his tent<WH168> door<WH6607>, and looked<WH5027> after<WH310> Moses<WH4872>, until he was gone<WH935> into the tabernacle<WH168>.

And it came to pass, as Moses<WH4872> entered<WH935> into the tabernacle<WH168>, the cloudy<WH6051> pillar<WH5982> descended<WH3381>, and stood<WH5975> at the door<WH6607> of the tabernacle<WH168>, and the LORD talked<WH1696> with Moses<WH4872>.

And all the people<WH5971> saw<WH7200> the cloudy<WH6051> pillar<WH5982> stand<WH5975> at the tabernacle<WH168> door<WH6607>: and all the people<WH5971> rose up<WH6965> and worshipped<WH7812>, every man<WH376> in his tent<WH168> door<WH6607>.

And the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872> face<WH6440> to face<WH6440>, as a man<WH376> speaketh<WH1696> unto his friend<WH7453>. And he turned again<WH7725> into the camp<WH4264>: but his servant<WH8334> Joshua<WH3091>, the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>, a young man<WH5288>, departed<WH4185> not out<WH8432> of the tabernacle<WH168>.

¶ And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto the LORD<WH3068>, See<WH7200>, thou sayest<WH559> unto me, Bring up<WH5927> this people<WH5971>: and thou hast not let me know<WH3045> whom thou wilt send<WH7971> with me. Yet thou hast said<WH559>, I know<WH3045> thee by name<WH8034>, and thou hast also found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in my sight<WH5869>.

Now therefore, I pray thee, if I have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in thy sight<WH5869>, shew<WH3045> me now thy way<WH1870>, that I may know<WH3045> thee, that I may find<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in thy sight<WH5869>: and consider<WH7200> that this nation<WH1471> is thy people<WH5971>.
And he said<WH559>, My presence<WH6440> shall go<WH3212> with thee, and I will give thee rest<WH5117>.
And he said<WH559> unto him, If thy presence<WH6440> go<WH1980> not with me, carry us not up<WH5927> hence.

For wherein shall it be known<WH3045> here<WH645> that I and thy people<WH5971> have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in thy sight<WH5869>? is it not in that thou goest<WH3212> with us? so shall we be separated<WH6395>, I and thy people<WH5971>, from all the people<WH5971> that are upon the face<WH6440> of the earth<WH127>.

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, I will do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697> also that thou hast spoken<WH1696>: for thou hast found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in my sight<WH5869>, and I know<WH3045> thee by name<WH8034>.
And he said<WH559>, I beseech thee<WH4994>, shew<WH7200> me thy glory<WH3519>.

And he said<WH559>, I will make all my goodness<WH2898> pass<WH5674> before thee, and I will proclaim<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068> before<WH6440> thee; and will be gracious<WH2603> to whom I will be gracious<WH2603>, and will shew mercy<WH7355> on whom I will shew mercy<WH7355>.
And he said<WH559>, Thou canst<WH3201> not see<WH7200> my face<WH6440>: for there shall no man<WH120> see<WH7200> me, and live<WH2425>.
And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559>, Behold, there is a place<WH4725> by me, and thou shalt stand<WH5324> upon a rock<WH6697>:

And it shall come to pass, while my glory<WH3519> passeth by<WH5674>, that I will put<WH7760> thee in a clift<WH5366> of the rock<WH6697>, and will cover<WH5526> thee with my hand<WH3709> while<WH5704> I pass by<WH5674>:
And I will take<WH5493> away mine hand<WH3709>, and thou shalt see<WH7200> my back parts<WH268>: but my face<WH6440> shall not be seen<WH7200>.
